intro: Muehlenbeckia rhyticarya, commonly known as the silver-haired everlasting, is a low-growing perennial plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Goodeniaceae family and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features slender, wiry stems covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are typically white or pale pink and appear in clusters. Muehlenbeckia rhyticarya is often found in coastal and subalpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
